result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Ryan Crist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs in this matter.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

cessation of Income Withholding Order

Case called at 1:18 PM.  Defendant Justin Ryan Crist in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant withdraws plea of not guilty and enters a plea of guilty.  Pleas and waiver form filed.  Court questions Defendant regarding Plea and Waiver of Rights.  Court also questions Attorney Angel regarding his client's plea and waiver of rights.  Parties stipulate to a factual basis.  Court finds plea is made freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.  Attorney Angel concurs with the State's request and makes statement on behalf of his client.  The court grants motion of parties.  Sentence withheld, probation ordered for a period of one year, with conditions.
Petition & Payment Of Adversary Counsel Fees
